actions.recommendation: Normal examination on the day.

Regular prostate screening, including PSA testing and clinical exams, becomes increasingly important with age. Your recent PSA levels (prostate marker) were normal, and you report no concerning symptoms. We will continue with routine screening.

Your clinical examination was unremarkable, with no concerning findings. Regular mole-mapping with a dermatologist is recommended to screen for any suspicious lesions. Early detection of irregularities can significantly improve management outcomes.
Healthy diet and lifestyle changes, showing some improvement in liver enzymes, homocysteine levels and uric acid levels. Non Smoker. Doing some exercise. Sleeps well.
Take omega 3 supplements 2g daily, eat a healthy mediterranean style diet and increase exercise to 5 times a week if possible.
Regular mole-mapping with a dermatologist is recommended to screen for any suspicious lesions.
Cholesterol levels: Already taking crestor 5mg. Keep dose the same and try manage with lifestyle only. Repeat blood after 6 months.
Liver enzymes: reduce unnecessary medicine intake and alcohol intake. Crestor can also increase liver enzymes and may be contributing to this.
Your clinical examination was unremarkable, with no concerning findings.
Please report any new urinary symptoms to your doctor.
Monitor blood pressure and implement lifestyle modifications as discussed on cardio pro.
Please follow a lower carbohydrate, higher good fat diet as discussed, cut out sugar, exercise regularly and watch your stress levels.
Regular mole-mapping with a dermatologist is recommended to screen for any suspicious lesions.
Raised fasting insulin may indicate insulin resistance and left unchecked could lead to type 2 diabetes. However this is completely reversible through diet and lifestyle.
Based on your age it is a good idea to see a urologist for a prostate check.
Repeat the level in March next year.
